channel.title: How-To Geek
channel.description: We explain technology. Learn more with our articles, reviews, tips, and the best answers to your most pressing tech questions.

item.title: How to Block Internet Access for Specific Android Apps
item.dc:creator: Faisal Rasool
item.description: A simple way to improve privacy, battery life, and data savings.
item.content:encoded: About a decade ago, I used to daily drive a custom Android ROM called CynanogenMod. In its settings app, there were in-built switches for cutting off any app’s internet access. Sadly, native Android still doesn’t have this feature, even in the latest version 16 update. Let me show you a workaround and why you might want to use it.

item.title: PS VR2 Could’ve Saved 3D Movies—But Sony Blew It
item.dc:creator: Sydney Butler
item.description: Am I the only one that liked 3D movies?
item.content:encoded: Believe it or not, the first ever 3D movie I saw was the original Avatar, and boy did that set a high bar for what 3D movies can be. During the peak of the last 3D movie fad, it was mainly a cinema experience for me. 3D TVs and Blu-rays were just too expensive for me back then, but these days people can hardly give their 3D movies away.

item.title: Why Android Launchers Were a Big Deal (And Why Most People Don’t Care Anymore)
item.dc:creator: Faisal Rasool
item.description: The rise and fall of personalization in Android.
item.content:encoded: There was a time when the first thing you did after getting a new Android phone was to throw a new launcher on it. Nova Launcher, Go Launcher, Apex Launcher, Action Launcher, ADW Launcher, and C Launcher come to mind. Today, however, outside enthusiast circles, people don’t seem to care about the launcher on their Android phone.

item.title: You Should Shop for Phones Like You Shop for a Car
item.dc:creator: Bertel King
item.description: Don't buy a phone at MSRP.
item.content:encoded: Much like cars, phones are a necessary part of modern life. It's time to approach buying them the same way.

item.title: 13 Things You Can Connect to Your iPhone's USB-C Port
item.dc:creator: Tim Brookes
item.description: Use your iPhone's port for more than just charging.
item.content:encoded: Most people only ever plug a charger into the USB-C port on their iPhone, but the interface is compatible with so many more devices. These can help you work or play, circumvent limitations, and get more done when you’re away from a “proper” computer.

item.title: How to Track Your Weight with Apple's Health App on iPhone
item.dc:creator: Nathaniel Pangaro
item.description: It's as easy as entering a number (or you can link a scale).
item.content:encoded: The Health app is the central hub for health tracking—from Apple Watch data to information from connected dietary apps that track your water intake or meals. The app organizes everything into easy-to-read graphics, metrics, and visuals to view your health data at a glance.

item.title: I Tried Running My Smart Home Without the Cloud—Here's What Happened
item.dc:creator: Tim Brookes
item.description: I wouldn't have it any other way.
item.content:encoded: Just like a home made from bricks and mortar, laying a solid foundation for your smart home will reward you in the long run. That’s why I decided that my smart home would not be reliant on the cloud to function, long before I bought my first smart plug or bulb.

item.title: These 6 Android Settings Could Be Putting Your Privacy in Danger
item.dc:creator: Aman Kumar
item.description: Keep your privacy secure by turning off these Android settings.
item.content:encoded: Your smartphone knows more about you than you know about yourself. Okay, that might be hyperbole, but it's still so important to manage the settings that track both your online and offline activity. Here are six Android settings that could put your privacy at risk and what you can do to keep your personal data safe.

item.title: This Turbocharged Crossover Delivers Affordable Thrills
item.dc:creator: Tyler Dupont
item.description: This turbocharged crossover blends lively performance, sharp handling, and everyday practicality without breaking the bank.
item.content:encoded: Performance and practicality rarely go hand in hand, especially in the compact crossover world. Yet one model manages to break that rule, offering genuine excitement without sacrificing everyday usability or value. With its turbocharged powertrain, sleek design, and premium interior, this crossover proves you don’t need a sports car to enjoy a thrilling drive.

item.title: 4 Big iPhone Features That Aren't Available in the United States
item.dc:creator: Tim Brookes
item.description: Think your iPhone has every feature? Think again.
item.content:encoded: “Designed by Apple in California” is a phrase that many have come to associate with the iPhone, but not all iPhones are built equally. Depending on where in the world you purchase and use your iPhone, you may have access to more features or other small differences in your device.
